result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) - .212 [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) - .212 [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Melissa Kaye Frost was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in person with Attorney Osborne.  Court modifies bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on October 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed to drive in Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am except for work purposes, treatment purposes, NA or AA as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.  Additional exceptions:  may be out until 9:00 p.m. to take children to their father's residence or for children's activies as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program, and may be outside on the property of her residence past curfew.
Defendant may attend a wedding reception at the Embassy Suites on American Blvd. in Bloomington, MN. on October 4, 2014 until 12:00 midnight, subject to approval by the Bond Monitoring Program.
Waiver of Prelim on September 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
